description:
Changes in the register (federal level)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12521 Statistics of foreigners

Definition:
The purpose of the balance of changes is to show how the
register stock results for the reference date (closing
stock) from the values of previous year's stock (opening
stock) and the changes that occurred during the reference
year. For the representation by citizenship at the federal
level, the following change items are relevant:
Additions to the register (total additions) comprise the
first entries and re-entries to Germany and the births of
foreigners in Germany.
Exits from the register comprise departures and ex-officio
deregistrations and deaths of foreigners in Germany.
Arrivals and departures (here including ex-officio
deregistrations) are often referred to as net immigration
from abroad.
Arrival and departure in the same year means that the
relevant persons stayed for less than 12 months in the
reference year. They are contained neither in the opening
stock nor in the closing stock of the year.
Also, the register stock is reduced by the deletion of
entries, typically by naturalisations (exit through deletion
from the Central Register of Foreigners).
The number of foreigners in a breakdown by citizenship is
also reduced by changes in citizenship. The value of a
citizenship increases when a foreigner acquires this
citizenship in the reference year and it decreases when a
foreigner loses the citizenship. The column "balance of
cases of citizenship acquired/lost" shows the balance of
these values. A positive balance means that the number of
foreigners acquiring this citizenship was larger than of
those losing it; a negative value means the opposite. Kosovo
is a typical example of a positive value and Serbia of a
negative value because, since 2008, many Kosovars exchanged
their former Serbian passport for a Kosovar passport.
The change items may include cases that did not occur in the
reference year, for example, when an arrival or a departure
which occurred in the preceding year was not covered in the
stock of that year and was covered in the reference year
instead.
